listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: The property has recently been refurbished and with a gross internal area of 1770 sq ft offers spacious and flexible living accommodation arranged over 4 floors comprising master bedroom with en-suite bathroom, 3 further bedrooms, family bathroom, a large bright and spacious double reception room, fitted kitchen, cloakroom, utility area and integral double length garage. There is also a large and pretty south facing balcony accessed from the reception room. The property occupies an elevated position and offers fantastic views over Dulwich Woods and towards central London. Sydenham Hill is well located for access to Dulwich Village, East Dulwich and Crystal Palace which offer a wide variety of shopping and leisure facilities, excellent schools and popular parks. Rail links to central London are from nearby Sydenham Hill & Crystal Palace stations. Offered with no onward chain. (EPC E)

The property benefits from a fully fitted spacious kitchen with room for both formal and casual dining as well as a breakfast bar area. A large main reception room and a downstairs WC are also present. On the first floor are 3 spacious bedrooms, one with en-suite and a family bathroom. Off street parking for two cars, gas central heating and double glazing. Offered chain free this is a property not to be missed.

listing.description: EPC band: DSituated on a sought after road this stunning end of terrace freehold 1/2 house (A house with a communal front door, shared with one other resident ) is immaculately presented throughout and offers a wealth of flexible living and entertaining space. To the front of the property is the attractive reception room benefitting from a high ceiling, fireplace and ample amounts of light from the box bay window. The dining room is open plan to the kitchen which benefits from integrated appliances, the bifold doors open onto the raised decked area of the garden, perfect for al fresco dining. Upstairs the first floor comprises of two bedrooms and family bathroom, on the second floor is an additional two bedrooms and a shower room.The local area offers some great places to eat and socialise, there are a number of convenience stores as well as a Sainsbury's Local, ideal for picking up groceries on the way back from work. There are five train stations which are easily accessible, Honor Oak, Crofton Park, Forest Hill, Catford and Catford Bridge, which provides fast and frequent services to London Bridge (in around 11mins) as well as London Overground services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington. If you're looking for outdoor activities, there are free tennis courts nearby as well as the open spaces of Blythe Hill Fields, Ladywell Park and Peckham Rye Park. There are a number of good schools in the area the nearest being Stillness primary and Dalmain Primary.
listing.short_description: Having undergone meticulous and extensive refurbishment to an exceptional standard, this four bedroom, two bathroom Victorian family home provides 1282 sq ft of elegantly arranged accommodation over three floors, with open plan living to the rear of the property and a South facing garden.

listing.description: SummaryLocated in Stoneleigh, in close proximity to the Ofsted outstanding Mead Infant and Nursery School, this four/five double bedroom, skilfully extended semi-detached home has been refurbished to an exceptional standard. Call now to arrange your viewing!DescriptionLocated in Stoneleigh, in close proximity to the Ofsted outstanding Mead Infant and Nursery School, this four/five double bedroom, skilfully extended semi-detached home has been refurbished to an exceptional standard.The property benefits from ample living space downstairs comprising of open plan double reception rooms finished with solid wood flooring and boasting feature fireplaces. Through the lounge you come to the extraordinary kitchen diner which has been extended to include double aspect windows, doors and Velux sky lights which saturate the whole ground floor with natural light. The kitchen/diner includes top of the range fitted appliances and solid stone flooring throughout. There is also a separate utility room and W/C as well as a large storage cupboard. The ground floor is finished by the substantial fifth bedroom/office. The front ground floor windows are fitted with shutters. To the first floor there are four double bedrooms of which the master has built in storage with automatic lighting. There is a modern shower room with waterfall shower as well as the luxurious family bathroom with three piece suite.Outside:The front of the property is a block paved driveway suitable for multiple cars. To the rear is an outstanding patio area perfect for al fresco dining and entertaining. Beyond the patio is a fantastic sized secluded lawn at the rear of which is a fully powered summer house.Location:Stoneleigh Station provides a direct link to London Waterloo in approximately 30 minutes and the property is well connected for bus routes to local towns such as Epsom & Kingston. Stoneleigh Broadway offers a convenient array of shops and restaurants and the property is well positioned for fantastic schools including The Mead Infants School (Ofsted 'Outstanding') and Auriol Junior School (Ofsted 'Good'). An early viewing comes highly recommended for this super family home.1. Money laundering regulations: Intending purchasers will be asked to produce identification documentation at a later stage and we would ask for your co-operation in order that there will be no delay in agreeing the sale.2. listing.description: The house is a particularly attractive looking three bedroom red-brick Victorian terrace and the garden faces west for afternoon and evening sun. This period home has been owned and occupied by the same family for several generations and has been well maintained and recently refurbished including new kitchen and bathroom, re-plastered, rewired and re-plumbed.Accommodation comprises; two reception rooms, kitchen-diner, garden, guest w/c, three double bedrooms, bathroom and loft space with potential to extend the ground floor side return and/or up into the loft and over the back addition, subject to planning consents. Vacant, chain free and in excellent condition, ready for immediate occupation.This quiet enclave of period homes boasts a variety of architectural styles and is a property hotspot to watch. Already popular with urban trendsetters as an alternative to Crouch End and Muswell Hill, it's extremely close to Turnpike Lane Underground Station (Piccadilly Line Zone 3) as well as Hornsey Overground for quick and convenient access to the West End and City. listing.description: Four double Bedrooms | two Reception Rooms | modern kitchen | two Bathrooms | 2112 SqFt | Close to schools | Garden room | Garage | Walking distance to Purley Train Station |Situated on a highly desirable side of Purley, this 4 bedroom, Edwardian, semi-detached property, is deceptively spacious in our opinion!There is an enclosed front porch, entrance hall, downstairs WC with a tiled floor, reception and dining room. The beautifully designed gallery kitchen is modern, spacious and bright. It has a double wine refrigerator and a newly installed double range cooker. Solid oak flooring runs throughout downstairs.On the first floor, there is a modern shower room, large family bathroom and 3 double bedrooms. The second floor comprises of an extra large 4th bedroom which has potential for multiple use.The property has benefitted from a refurbishment to a high standard. The owner informs us that this includes a full rewire in 2013, complete electrical, hard cabled alarm, heat detectors, fire alarms, cat6 data cabling, and ariel.Outside, there is a raised patio with a level, low maintenance landscaped garden. The versatile garden room was built in 2015. It can be used to entertain, as an office or studio/ gym!The garden room has been constructed using high performance sips, has cedar cladding and a resin sealed roof. Internally, there is an origin bifold door, power, an ariel, cat6 data cable, fully wired in metal conduit, with flexible lighting installed.To the side of the property is a single garage. There is still opportunity to extend, should you wish and sttp.Purley and the surrounding area, is renowned for a broad selection of state and independent schools, including some highly sought after grammar schools. The range of schools are : Wilson’s, Wallington Girls, Wallington Boys, John Fisher, Cumnor House, St David’s, Margaret Roper, Thomas Moore and Whitgift to name a few.Purley town centre is within walking distance and has a range of amenities including the Purley Leisure Centre which offers membership and has a swimming pool. Purley offers a fantastic variety of restaurants. The main line station is Purley, where you will find fast and frequent trains into central London ( London Bridge & London Victoria). The M25 is also easily accessible providing links to Gatwick and the South coast.Other Information....Parking Arrangements: Off streetVendors position: Potentially No onward chainCouncil Tax Band: ETenure: FreeholdPotential Rental Value: Potentially £2400 pcmAge of Boiler: 5 years, recently servicedWindows Installed: Double GlazedGarden Direction: West FacingGarden Fence: Left side and back

The property is steeped in charm and aesthetic appeal from the era in which it was built. It is awash with eye-catching original features - from its attractive brick façade to its high ceilings, sash windows (most are double-glazed and newly refurbished), ornamental cast iron fireplace and richly coloured polished solid hard wooden floors. This is a house that impresses right the way throughout its elegantly appointed interior.The ground floor comprises of a warm, welcoming reception hall, a bright, airy and spacious Lounge/Dining Room and a separate kitchen to the rear. The first floor consists of two double bedrooms together with a large four-piece family bathroom suite which comes complete with a Victorian style stand-alone roll top bath and independent shower unit. The property benefits from having direct access from the kitchen on to a well-maintained garden featuring a flagstone terrace leading to a raised decked area to the rear with various mature flower and shrub borders surrounding. There is also ample storage capacity in the form of a variety of built in cupboards, twin wardrobes in the Master Bedroom, as well as large storage space in the loft.LocationThe property is located in a highly sought-after conservation area, and is only a five-minute walk from the Stepney City Farm: A beautiful working farm in the heart of Tower Hamlets with a highly popular Saturday farmers market. For the ease and convenience of commuters, the property lies within around just ½ mile of Shadwell Overground/DLR, Limehouse DLR as well as Stepney Green District/Hammersmith & City Line Tube Station. The impending arrival of the Elizabeth Line to nearby Whitechapel promises to make access into and through Central London and Heathrow Airport even speedier! The property's favourable location means that you will have some of London's world famous cultural, culinary and social hotspots at your convenient disposal. Despite the quiet and secluded location, vibrant Brick Lane and the famous Columbia Road flower market are within easy reach, as is the bustle of the City to the West and Stratford to the East. Beautiful green spaces are also easily accessible, including the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park with its many attractions, and Victoria Park. Limehouse, Narrow Street and the river are also within a short stroll.

listing.letting_fees:
Transparency for tenants

*Client Money Protection is provided by Propertymark. The redress scheme for Marsh & Parsons is The Property Ombudsman Scheme.*

Once you've found the perfect property and your offer has been accepted, we'll start preparing the tenancy agreement and organising the logistics for your 'move-in' day. The tenancy charges may vary, depending on the agreement we have with the landlord, so it's best to ask the Marsh & Parsons office dealing with your offer for a full break down of costs.

That said, we don't want you to have any unwelcome surprises when it comes to signing the contract, so here's a list of what you can typically expect to pay:

Pre-Tenancy All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)

Tenancy Agreement / Admin Fee £270
Referencing Fee £30 per reference (including references for any proposed Guarantor)
Check-in Fee £130.80
Deposit Typically six weeks rent
Pet Deposit Returnable additional security deposit, equivalent to two weeks' rent

During your tenancy (if required) All Fees stated are inclusive of VAT (calculated at 20%)
Renewal Document Fee £72
Change of Occupancy £120
Future Landlord Reference Fee £36

For more information regarding the lettings process, please visit the Lettings Advice for Tenants page.


Fees explained


Tenancy Agreement/Admin Fee - Provision of an expertly written tenancy agreement, brokering agreed amendments between landlord and tenant, and arrangement for completion and signature of the agreement by both parties, and registering your deposit with the Tenancy Deposit Scheme. Your deposit is typically six weeks rent.

Referencing Fee - The cost of referencing includes checking your credit status, previous employer, current or past landlords, and taking into account any other information to help assess the affordability of your tenancy application.

Check-in Fee - The cost of arranging for a clerk to meet you and agree the current inventory of the property at the start of your tenancy. The cost of the check-out at the end of the tenancy is met by the landlord.

Pet Deposit (Returnable) - To cover the added risk of property damage. This will be protected with your security deposit and may be returned at the end of the tenancy.

Renewal Document Fee - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Change of Occupancy - Contract negotiation, amending and updating terms and arranging a further tenancy and agreement.

Future Landlord Reference Fee - Collating information and preparing a reference for a future landlord or letting agent.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: Stunning four bedroom Victorian semi detached family home, which has been the subject of complete refurbishment by the current owner. The property offers superb, well proportioned accommodation laid out over three floors including an impressive, beautifully designed open plan kitchen with skylights and bi-folding doors onto the low maintenance rear garden, stylish 'Hanover' limestone en-suite shower to the spacious master bedroom, and a modern family bathroom. The refurbishment has also included new double glazing, re-wiring and new Nest heating system, as well as attractive new oak wood flooring.Accommodation comprises entrance hall with access to a ground floor cloakroom / toilet and stairs rising to the first floor, leading to a bright and spacious reception room with front aspect bay. The separate dining room opens out onto the stunning kitchen, expertly fitted with a modern range of matching wall and base units including Fired Earth glass tiles, central island and incorporating fully integrated appliances. Two skylights and bi-folding doors to the garden flood the room with plenty of natural light. To the first floor, there are three generously sized bedrooms plus a family bathroom, and the second floor accommodates the large master bedroom with stylish en-suite shower room.The property is in an enviable no through road cul-de-sac location in Sundridge Park village, within easy access of both Sundridge Park and Bromley North stations, each providing excellent links into Central London. There are a selection of local shops in the village, as well as two Ofsted outstanding primary schools and, pre schools. Bromley town centre is just a short distance away providing a wider range of shops, bars, restaurants and amenities.Viewing of this fantastic family home is highly recommended.

The Mount Square is located only moments from Hampstead Underground station, fashionable cafes, boutiques and restaurants of Hampstead Village.

listing.description: A two-bedroom ground floor apartment with patio garden and garage. The property is located on a purpose-built retirement development for the over 55s. Management services are provided by Cognatum Estates, a not-for-profit organisation and one of the uk's leading companies in retirement housing.Until the arrival of the railway in 1905, Ickenham was a remote rural village with a population of little more than 300 people. Today it is a thriving London suburb in Hillingdon. Church Place however, built in the former paddock and farmyard of Home Farm, retains much of the serenity of its past, like the nearby ornate village pump and pond. The estate has cottages and apartments around two charming garden courtyards and a large timbered barn restored for social events.Ickenham has a wide range of shops and other facilities and is served by the Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines, making it ideal for pensioners who may travel into London free of charge. Despite its London location, it is a lively village at heart, with an annual community festival, rugby and cricket clubs and a wealth of societies. Ruislip Golf Club is a few minutes away by car, as is Bayhurst Wood Country Park with its abundance of birds and wildflowers. The estate is very well-placed for travel by road, rail and air.Cognatum Estates maintains, repairs and insures all the buildings, arranges the window cleaning and refuse collection and tends to the gardens and grounds thereby freeing owners and residents from these responsibilities. There is a personal alarm system in each property and resident estate managers are available to provide support and a helping hand when needed making this an ideal 'Lock Up & Leave' property.There is a laundry facility on site and a guest suite provides comfortable accommodation for family and friends.The cost of providing these services is shared equally between all properties. There are no restrictions on owning a property except that one resident must be over 55 years of age.150 year lease (from 1994). No ground rent.For viewings please contact / 821160

listing.description: Fully extended to the rear and into the loft in recent years, this traditional Victorian home has been internally transformed to provide sumptuous living, entertaining and family space.Providing three large double bedrooms, two large bathrooms, the home's defining aspect is the ground level that has been expertly developed to create three inter-connecting large areas, the showpiece being the large, designer kitchen-diner with direct access to the large rear garden.Spread over three floors, the home has been beautifully refurbished and extended to an awe-inspiring standard. The kitchen provides granite worktops, new inbuilt appliances underfloor heating and the full height glazed tri-fold doors provide seamless access to the landscaped rear garden.Other details throughout the home include underfloor heating in both bathrooms, walnut flooring, rain sensor electric veluxes, custom black out blinds, newly installed carpets throughout. The en-suite loft bathroom includes Italian imported fixtures and fittings.Located in the catchment for Hobbayne Primary and Drayton Manor and close to specialist French and Welsh schools. There is a raft of nurseries, Montessori's and family friendly amenities in the area including Hanwell Zoo and plenty of children's activities and classes. Leisurely walks are afforded through Golden Manor towards Brent Valley and the River Brent.The Avenue, a wide tree-lined road, with a variety of locally well renowned shops, cafes and local amenities is nearby. There is a large Waitrose, Sainsbury's and a local Farmer's Market on a Saturday all in walking distance and the Drayton Court is a well regarded local watering hole with one of the largest beer gardens in London.West Ealing and Hanwell stations are set to be transformed with the arrival of Crossrail. Both stations are currently undergoing extensive work readying them for the increased commuters looking to take advantage of journey times to Central London forecast to be around 13 minutes to Bond St on commuter trains that will hold double the number of passengers to a current tube train.Please call Go View London for your private appointment to view on .

listing.short_description:
**Jaw Dropping Exceptional Refurbishment**Substantially Extended Family Home**Absolute Must See** This is an absolutely unmissable property for those looking for the ultimate family home! Refurbished, extended and delivered to a show home standard throughout, this stunning 4 bed family home is a must see for those looking for a property that needs absolutely nothing doing other than to move in, unpack and enjoy the benefits of thoughtful, neutral decor and large open rooms that are perfect for spending time with family and friends all year round. Situated within walking distance of Sutton town centre and benefiting from fantastic school catchment and convenient transport links, this is the ideal property for those needing to commute swiftly by road or rail whilst still living in a quiet residential road close to amenities that include a local chain supermarket, a health centre offering various clubs and activities and parkland. Downstairs offers a good sized hallway, large separate reception room with a stunning curved bay window and to the rear a huge open plan kitchen area that opens up onto a dining / lounge area that further opens onto the immaculate garden via a wall of larger than average sliding doors. Further benefits to the ground floor include a separate utility room, guest WC and access to the integrated garage. To the first floor there are two double bedrooms, a good sized single bedroom and a modern family bathroom featuring both bath and separate shower. On the top floor, the loft conversion offers a substantial master bedroom and an en-suite bathroom that offers a jacuzzi bath and shower cubicle. To the rear there is a good sized garden with two patio areas and a large grassed area as well as shed and there is off street parking to the front. The current owners have genuinely thought of everything whilst meticulously and carefully upgrading, extending and beautifying this lovely family home and as such we can highly recommend that view quickly, it will not be around for long!

Reception Room (16' 5'' x 11' 6'' (5m x 3.5m))

Finished to an exceptionally high standard, this large reception room is separate from the open plan living area and benefits from a large bay window, bringing in good natural light, wooden flooring and modern, neutral decor.

Lounge / Diner (11' 10'' x 24' 7'' (3.6m x 7.5m))

Running the length of this spectacular family home, the lounge/dining area offers ample space for flexible use including play area, entertaining and family time to relax. Opening up onto the well presented garden this is the perfect set up to spill into the outdoors in summer months or watch the elements at their worst in winter.

Kitchen / Breakfast Room (9' 10'' x 17' 9'' (3m x 5.4m))

If you could design your dream kitchen, this would be it! Clean lines, mood lighting and every integrated appliance you could possible want, all around a substantial central island, this stunning kitchen manages to offer unmistakable wow factor whilst still managing to be functional and spacious.

Utility Room (4' 3'' x 7' 3'' (1.3m x 2.2m))

A must have with open plan living, this small but perfectly formed utility room offers space for both washer and dryer as well as a folding area, all tucked away behind a closed door.

Cloakroom (2' 11'' x 6' 3'' (0.9m x 1.9m))

Situated off of the utility room, this pristine guest WC offers a vanity unit with storage, WC and heated towel rail.

Master Bedroom (21' 0'' x 12' 6'' (6.4m x 3.8m))

This substantial master bedroom is situated in the newly built loft extension and offers amazing views from the huge juliet window. Beautifully presented and in immaculate condition, this is a truly stunning master bedroom with ample room for even the largest of furniture pieces.

Master En-Suite (9' 2'' x 5' 11'' (2.8m x 1.8m))

Simply stunning, the master en-suite bathroom offers a full size bath with jacuzzi functionality to ease those stresses away, a separate shower cubicle, vanity sink with storage and WC. So immaculate that you would think you were in a 5 star hotel, this gorgeous bathroom also benefits from natural light and ventilation from a large window over the bath.

Bedroom 2 (16' 9'' x 10' 6'' (5.1m x 3.2m))

Originally the master bedroom, bedroom 2 is a substantial master bedroom that offers a picturesque bay window with window seat, fitted wardrobes and neutral decor throughout.

Bedroom 3 (13' 1'' x 10' 6'' (4m x 3.2m))

Like the rest of this absolutely perfect family home, this large double bedroom has been refurbished to a very high standard and is neutrally decorated throughout.

Bedroom 4 / Office (10' 6'' x 7' 3'' (3.2m x 2.2m))

Currently used as a home office, bedroom 4 is a larger than average single bedroom for this style property and as such would comfortably accommodate a single bed as well as other expected furniture.

Family Bathroom (9' 2'' x 6' 11'' (2.8m x 2.1m))

This amazing property just keeps on giving - the family bathroom doesn't disappoint. Featuring a large shower enclosure, bath, vanity sink and WC, this gorgeous bathroom is newly installed and immaculately presented.

listing.description: This Semi-Detached family home has recently been extended and refurbished comprehensively to create a fantastic family space. There are three large double bedrooms with an additional single bedroom, the principal bedroom has the benefit of an en-suite shower room and Juliet balcony. The rear of the property has been extended to create a large kitchen-dining room with direct access to the mature south easterly backing garden.Greenhayes Avenue is an established, tree lined road off Bolters Lane within a few minutes' walk to the excellent local amenities of Banstead High Street including Marks & Spencer Simply Food, Waitrose Supermarket and a number of quality independent shops and cafés. Banstead Station is accessible with a faster rail service to London available from Sutton. The A217 provides fast access to the M25 at Junction 8 (Reigate Hill). The area has a choice of good schools and the open spaces of Banstead Downs are nearby.
listing.short_description: Just a stone's throw from the High Street, this well presented four bedroom semi-detached house offers a great opportunity to purchase a family home in the heart of Banstead Village on an ever popular tree-lined road.

listing.description: A beautifully refurbished five bedroom family home, benefiting from off-street parking, a West-facing garden and high-spec finish throughout.The ground floor comprises a wide and bright entrance hall, leading to a downstairs bedroom which could also serve as a home office or play room; leading through to a stunning and spacious open plan family room with clearly defined seating and dining areas. There is a beautifully finished kitchen with bi-folding doors to the garden, all complemented with engineered wooden flooring and a neutral light finish. There is a smart downstairs shower room/WC and further double bedroom, providing versatile accommodation. To the first floor there are three double bedrooms and a modern family bathroom. Externally, there is parking for two cars to the fore, and secure side access with lean to provide storage for bikes.This stunning property is set back from Twickenham Road on a slip-road, with all local amenities and bus-routes close by. Twickenham Railway Station is nearby and the house is well-placed for excellent local schooling and recreational facilities.EPC Grade C.
listing.short_description: A beautifully refurbished five bedroom family home, benefiting from off-street parking, a West-facing garden and high-spec finish throughout. The ground floor comprises a wide and bright entrance hall, leading to a downstairs bedroom which could also serve as a home office or play room; leading through to a stunning and spacious open plan family room with clearly defined seating and dining areas. listing.description: James Pendleton has great pleasure introducing to the market a charming and beautifully presented semi-detached Victorian cottage.The property benefits from being fully refurbished throughout with an elegant mix of Victorian period features and contemporary fittings. The ground floor accommodation comprises a charming reception room at the front with a feature fireplace and wooden floors, at the rear is a stunning kitchen breakfast room. The kitchen has a range of base and eye level shaker style units, wooden work surfaces and stylish metro tiles. The kitchen further benefits from a large under stairs storage cupboard. A door from the kitchen leads out to a secluded pretty rear garden which is South West facing which also benefits from having side access. Arranged over the first floor are two generous double bedrooms and a beautiful family bathroom.The property could be further enhanced with a side return and or loft conversion, the current owners had planning granted for this in 2017.The property is located on Archbishops Place which is a quiet residential no through road just off Brixton Hill. The amenities and abundance of leisure facilities and transport links local to Brixton, Streatham, Hearne Hill and Clapham Street are within close proximity of this highly desirable house.

listing.letting_fees:
New assured shorthold tenancies (ASTs) signed on or after 1 June 2019

Holding Deposit (per tenancy): One week’s rent. This is to reserve a property. Please Note: This will be withheld if any relevant person (including any guarantor(s)) withdraw from the tenancy, fail a Right- to-Rent check, provide materially significant false or misleading information, or fail to sign their tenancy agreement (and / or Deed of Guarantee) within 15 calendar days (or other Deadline for Agreement as mutually agreed in writing).

Security Deposit (per tenancy. Rent under £50,000 per year): Five weeks’ rent. This covers damages or defaults on the part of the tenant during the tenancy.

Security Deposit (per tenancy. Rent over £50,000 per year): Six weeks’ rent. This covers damages or defaults on the part of the tenant during the tenancy.

Unpaid Rent: Interest at 3% above the Bank of England Base Rate from Rent Due Date until paid in order to pursue non-payment of rent. Please Note: This will not be levied until the rent is more than 14 days in arrears

Lost Key(s) or other Security Device(s): Tenants are liable to the actual cost of replacing any lost key(s) or other security device(s). If the loss results in locks needing to be changed, the actual costs of a locksmith, new lock and replacement keys for the tenant, landlord any other persons requiring keys will be charged to the tenant. If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £15 per hour (inc. VAT) for the time taken replacing lost key(s) or other security device(s).

Variation of Contract (Tenant’s Request): £50 (inc. VAT) per agreed variation. To cover the costs associated with taking landlord’s instructions as well as the preparation and execution of new legal documents.

Change of Sharer (Tenant’s Request): £50 (inc. VAT) per replacement tenant or any reasonable costs incurred if higher. To cover the costs associated with taking landlord’s instructions, new tenant referencing and Right-to-Rent checks, deposit registration as well as the preparation and execution of new legal documents.

Early Termination (Tenant’s Request): Should the tenant wish to leave their contract early; they shall be liable to the landlord’s costs in re-letting the property as well as all rent due under the tenancy until the start date of the replacement tenancy. These costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding on the tenancy.

Pet Deposit (if applicable and if requested by the landlord): 2 weeks’ additional security deposit will be levied
listing.description: Offering ample living space and potential for improvement, this 4-bedroom period house is ideally placed for Honor Oak Park station and is being sold with no onward chain.The house boasts well-proportioned rooms, high ceilings and period fireplaces. Through the traditional front door, you enter into a generous hallway. On the ground floor are 2 good-sized reception rooms both with period fireplaces and exposed wooden floorboards. There's an eat-in kitchen at the back which leads through to a utility room. There's also a handy WC on the ground floor. Upstairs are 3 genuine double bedrooms, a single bedroom and a family bathroom with a separate WC. The rear garden extends to around 40' and is mainly laid to lawn.Honor Oak Park station is round a 5-minute walk away from where there are fast and regular services into London Bridge (in around 12 minutes). You can also pick up the Overground from here for services northwards to Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington, and southwards to Croydon.The area's amenities include coffee shops, a deli, a beauty salon, and several highly-rated restaurants including a hip pizzeria (Mama Dough), an award-winning Indian (Babur), a popular Italian (Le Querce) and a traditional Turkish (Hattush). For groceries there are a number of convenience shops and a Sainsbury's local along the high street. For an evening drink, there's the recently-refurbished Chandos or the Brockley Jack which also hosts a small theatre. There are a number of good primary schools locally the nearest being Stillness.The area is dotted with green spaces including One Tree Hill and Blythe Hill Fields at the top of which are panoramic views of London's skyline.
listing.short_description: Offering ample living space and potential for improvement, this 4-bedroom period house is ideally placed for Honor Oak Park station and is being sold with no onward chain.

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property, there are various costs that you will need to take into consideration when making an offer.

Below, we have outlined the applicable charges payable when renting a home from Chestertons:

- Tenant administration fee: £222 (inc. VAT) This is payable after your offer has been accepted and we have proceeded to draw up a tenancy agreement.
- Reference fee for each Tenant or Guarantor: £42. This is payable when you have agreed to undergo the independent referencing process. References are carried out by an independent Third Party.
- Renewal administration fee: £96 (inc. VAT). This is payable upon renewal, should you and your landlord mutually agree to renew the tenancy for a further term.
- Inventory charges. In most lets, tenants will be responsible for paying for the inventory check out costs upon ending a tenancy. The cost is approximately £95 - £250 (Plus VAT) dependent on the size of the property. When budgeting prior to your home search, do not forget to also factor in your Tenancy Deposit, which is usually the equivalent of 6 weeks' rent. Tenants will also normally be responsible for paying for a professional clean at the end of the tenancy.

Should you have any queries regarding the charges and costs associated with renting a property, please do not hesitate to contact one of our lettings consultants who shall be happy to explain these in further detail.
listing.description: A superb three bedroom family home benefitting from off street parking and approx 82 foot private rear garden backing onto King George's Park. Having been totally refurbished by the current owners, the property is presented in beautiful condition.The house comprises entrance hall leading to double reception offering ample space for reception and dining areas. The modern kitchen sits beyond and opens out onto approx 82 feet of private garden space, backing onto the park. A modern bathroom with a separate WC completes the ground floor. The first floor provides three bedrooms and opens into a loft room (with reduced head height) which provides an excellent opportunity to convert (stpp).The property is well located close to the newly completed Southside Shopping Centre which has a range of facilities and shops including a large Waitrose and Multiplex Cinema, as well as an assortment of restaurants and bars. King George's Park is behind with its green open spaces, tennis courts and playgrounds. Wandsworth Town Station is 0.5 miles away and East Putney Underground Station is 0.8 miles away. Nearby bus routes also offer further useful alternatives.

listing.description: A recently refurbished, utterly pristine four bedroom family home, artfully spread out over three floors and mere moments from the peaceful streets of Walthamstow Village. You have a positively capacious kitchen/diner, immaculate rear garden and Design & Decor is thoroughly boxfresh throughout.There're plenty of extra special touches such as underfloor heating in the kitchen/diner and a pressurised cylinder and boiler system for heating and hot water, located in the outdoor storage area.If you lived hereYou'll be stretching out in almost 1500 square feet of living space, the jewel in your crown undoubtedly the breathtaking kitchen/diner; coming at over 400 square feet, it's all brightly lit by large, twin skylights and a set of bi-folding patio doors taking up almost the entire rear wall. Underfoot, it's engineered hardwood throughout and you have a large breakfast bar in the centre. Your double width, stainless steel chef's oven is so new it still has the stickers on it.Timber worktops, metro tile splashbacks and chrome fittings complete the effect, while the whole space can be thrown open to the garden; an immaculate mix of patio and zero-maintenance tru-lawn, flanked by raised beds and timber fencing. Back inside your 140 square foot lounge makes for a fine secondary hosting option, bright, spotless and spacious.Head upstairs and your master bedroom's an impressive 150 square feet, with plush carpeting underfoot and a constellation of recessed spotlights overhead. The floor's completed by a second double bedroom and a generous single. Plus the family bathroom, sleekly finished in smoky grey and glass. Finally, the penthouse suite consists of a skylit, 315 square foot master with twin skylights, Juliet balcony and sparkling en suite.What else?- Walthamstow Village's award-winning array of independent restaurants, bars and gastropubs are around a third of a mile on foot. From the traditional Sunday Roasts at The Castle, to the delicious burgers and classic cocktails at Eat17, there's something for every taste.- Current and prospective parents will be pleased to know that you have no fewer than twenty six primary/secondary schools in a one mile radius, all rated 'Good' or better by Ofsted.- Walthamstow Central station is fifteen minutes on foot and offers regular, direct routes to Liverpool Street and Oxford Circus, both just twenty minutes away.Lounge (4.2m x 3.2m (13'9" x 10'5"))WcKitchen/Diner (7.9m x 4.8m (25'11" x 15'8"))Bedroom (2.1m x 1.9m (6'10" x 6'2"))Bedroom (4.2m x 3.2m (13'9" x 10'5"))Bedroom (3.8m x 3.2m (12'5" x 10'5"))Bathroom (2.7m x 1.9m (8'10" x 6'2"))Bedroom (6.5m x 4.9m (21'3" x 16'0"))Ensuite (2.7m x 1.4m (8'10" x 4'7"))Garden (7.62m (25))Explore our 'Wonders of Walthamstow' pages for everything our awesome community has to offer.From the critically acclaimed bars and restaurants of Walthamstow Village, to the wide green spaces of Lloyd Park and Hollow Pond.From the 20 minute tube ride into Oxford Street to the fact that you don't have to be a Russian Oligarch to afford a family home here.For these reasons and more, people have spent the past two years flocking to E17 and surrounding areas.

Standard Fees

References

listing.letting_fees:
Fees

When renting a property with Currell, please be aware that fees will apply during the process. Details of these fees are as follows:

Administration Fees (Non-optional)
We charge £360 (including VAT) to cover the cost of administering the initial tenancy.
For example our team of administrators will be responsible for the drafting and completion of the Tenancy Agreement (including any individually negotiated clauses), progressing the status of the proposed Tenancy, accounting and reconciliation of monies paid by the Tenants and coordinating between the referencing agency, relevant Tradesman for either compliance or works agreed, Inventory Clerks (where applicable) and the Lettings Negotiator. For clarity, this is a charge per tenancy and not per applicant. An additional £360 (including VAT) will be charged in advance for any variation to the existing agreement (if your landlord is in agreement), plus any referencing charges.

Referencing Fees (Non-optional)
We use an independent referencing agency (rmt - Reference-My-Tenant) to carry out reference checks on all tenants. The cost of these checks are £40 (including VAT) per individual joining the tenancy and £50 (including VAT) if a company is being referenced. For clarity, each individual named in the tenancy agreement will need to pay a referencing fee. For example, 3 tenants = 3 referencing fees.

Check-In Fees (Non optional in the event that the Landlord uses the services of an Independent Inventory Clerk)
We use an independent inventory company (normally Ready Report) to carry out a Check-In and Check-Out service on all properties (subject to the landlord confirming that they wish to use this service). The cost of a check-in and check-out are identical and can vary from £105 (including VAT) to £360 (including VAT) dependent on the size of property and the amount of furnishings in the property. Usually, tenants pay for a check-in and landlords pay for the check-out. For clarity, check-in fees are payable per tenancy, not per applicant.

Early Termination (Non-optional in the event of leaving earlier than the tenancy allows)
A fundamental responsibility as a tenant is to pay your rent, but we recognize there may be circumstances whereby you need to break out of your tenancy early. If your Landlord agrees that the property can be re advertised, in order to find a suitable replacement tenant to take over your liability, you still need to continue making your regular rent payments until a new tenant takes occupation. In addition you will need to cover the Landlords fees for the unexpired term of your tenancy. These fees are calculated on a pro rata basis. Should you be thinking of leaving earlier than your tenancy agreement permits, you should contact your local branch as soon as possible for a detailed breakdown of the costs involved.

Other Fees and Information
Currell also works on behalf of institutional, rather than private, Landlords who may have their own administration procedures and fees. This can mean that the costs vary from those detailed above. Details of these fees are available upon request, but please be assured that if these landlords charge fees then you will not be liable to pay any fees to us.
listing.description: This stunning refurbished one bedroom house is a rare to the market home and a perfect city retreat. The house has light in abundance due to an east to west orientation providing morning sun to the front and late afternoon and evening sun in the garden.Independent Place is a gated development providing peace and tranquillity with a mixture of houses, apartments, work spaces and a communal garden, and this particular property has the benefit of two allocated parking spaces. Arranged at just over 800sqft this space would suit a young professional or couple looking to purchase their first home. The ground floor comprises an open plan reception kitchen with French doors to the front along with Bi folding doors to the rear opening out to the garden. The first floor has the main living reception room and family bathroom where stairs take you to a double bedroom along with an ensuite shower room. The house also features copious amounts of bespoke fitted storage throughout.Independent Place is moments from Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground stations; these lines offer various routes towards Shoreditch, Canary Wharf and Highbury and Islington (change for Victoria Underground line) The many bus routes up and down Kingsland High Street offer an alternative London commute. This is a superb location for the alternative bars, restaurants and shops of Dalston along with being a short trip to Upper Street, N1. The ever popular Broadway market with its weekly market is close by along with the energising green space of London Fields.

listing.description: Nestled away in this quiet, tree lined, residential road is where you will find this great four bedroom end of terrace house. As you walk up the path to the property you instantly fall in love with the house as it has significant kerb appeal. This beautifully presented house has an abundance of charm and character including features such as the original windows. This is an ideal family home with well proportioned living and sleeping accommodation. The large window in the lounge floods the room with natural light and is a great space to entertain family and friends.The current owners have carried out numerous works to enhance the property giving this home a cosy feel throughout. It is literally ready to move into ideal for someone who simply wants to move in and unpack.The jewel in the crown is the spacious kitchen/dining area which is great for those who enjoy hosting dinner parties or families who simply like to sit and enjoy a breakfast or evening meal together. You also have the luxury of having both rear and side access to the generously sized garden which is extremely practical and saves the inconvenience of having muddy bikes taken through the house.The location of this property is extremely sought after and commuters are well served as it is just a stones throw away from Wood Street Station providing fast direct access to The City and Central London.What the Owner says:We originally bought this property five years ago and have completely refurbished it since moving in. What first appealed to us were the original features that the property has and the fact that it had so much potential for us to put our own stamp on it.We love the location, as soon as we walked down the road we know it was where we wanted to live. listing.description: Set at the end of a quiet and secluded tree lined cul-de-sac, surrounded by green spaces, is this lovely Victorian two bedroom cottage. With a finish complementing the cottage feel and contemporary London alike, the property boasts sash windows, original wood flooring, fireplaces and a front and rear garden. As you enter is a family reception, leading to a dining room and recently refurbished kitchen with underfloor heating. French doors lead through to the back garden. The bathroom is set to the rear of the house, while stairs lead up to the two double bedrooms.There is a close community spirit with a street party at least once a year. It is within easy access of a number of green spaces including Victoria Park and Stepney City Farm, as well as being only a few tube stops from Westfield in Stratford and from the world class sports facilities at the Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. There are various ofstead outstanding and good schools are nearby.The property is well situated for public transport, with Stepney Green Underground Station (approx. 250m - Hammersmith and City, District Lines) and Mile End Underground Station (approx. 750m - Central Line) being close by, along with the many bus routes in the area.

listing.letting_fees:
When renting a property, there are various costs that you will need to take into consideration when making an offer.

Below, we have outlined the applicable charges payable when renting a home from Chestertons:

- Tenant administration fee: £222 (inc. VAT) This is payable after your offer has been accepted and we have proceeded to draw up a tenancy agreement.
- Reference fee for each Tenant or Guarantor: £42. This is payable when you have agreed to undergo the independent referencing process. References are carried out by an independent Third Party.
- Renewal administration fee: £96 (inc. VAT). This is payable upon renewal, should you and your landlord mutually agree to renew the tenancy for a further term.
- Inventory charges. In most lets, tenants will be responsible for paying for the inventory check out costs upon ending a tenancy. The cost is approximately £95 - £250 (Plus VAT) dependent on the size of the property. When budgeting prior to your home search, do not forget to also factor in your Tenancy Deposit, which is usually the equivalent of 6 weeks' rent. Tenants will also normally be responsible for paying for a professional clean at the end of the tenancy.

Should you have any queries regarding the charges and costs associated with renting a property, please do not hesitate to contact one of our lettings consultants who shall be happy to explain these in further detail.
listing.description: This stunning two bedroom Victorian, end of terrace cottage has been completely refurbished to an extremely high standard.The accommodation comprises double reception room with a polished concrete floor and integrated sound system, fully extended kitchen / dining room with sliding doors leading out to the rear landscaped garden. Upstairs the master bedroom has fitted wardrobes, the second bedroom makes a perfect nursery or home office and a contemporary bathroom benefits from under-floor heating. The house also benefits from off-street parking and a secure, side store room, perfect for bikes. The property also offers a large loft space perfect for additional storage.Medfield Street is located off Putney Heath, with the green open spaces of Richmond Park and Wimbledon Common nearby. Local shops can be found on Roehampton High Street, and the area also benefits from a Little Waitrose. There are excellent bus routes to Putney, Barnes, Kingston & Hammersmith, and easy access out of London is found via the A3.

listing.description: A fantastic light bright and spacious 1142 sq ft / 106 sqm newly refurbished Semi Detached family house located on this quiet residential road in the heart of the Golf Link Estate in East Acton. Accommodation comprisesentrance hall, 14ft (4.2m) reception area leading to 11ft (3.3m) dining area and then onto open plan fully integrated 12ft (3.8) kitchen with door to the garden. Also on the ground floor is the 9ft (2.8m) bedroom four, two storage cupboards and lastly the cloakroom/wc. The first floor comprises landing, 11ft (3.4m) bedroom one with built in wardrobes and en-suite shower room, two further bedrooms and family bathroom/wc. The property further benefits 25ft (7.8m) a mainly decked rear garden with side access, off street parking to the front and is available to buy with no onward chain.The Bye is located between Long Drive and The Green with easy access to East Acton Central Line (zone 2) Station, bus routes to Westfield, Notting Hill and West End are also close by.
